quizSrc.term: What are the four main factors that a solutions architect should consider when they must choose a Region? 1 point A. Latency, price, service availability, and compliance B. quizSrc.term: Which of the following is a benefit of cloud computing? 1 point A. Run and maintain your own data centers. B. Increase time-to-market. C. Overprovision for scale. D. Go global in minutes.

quizSrc.term: What is a best practice when securing the AWS account root user? 1 point A. Activate AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) access to the Billing and Cost Management console B. Use the root user for routine administrative tasks C. Change account settings D. Enable multi-factor authentication

A solutions architect is consulting for a company. When users in the company authenticate to a corporate network, they want to be able to use AWS without needing to sign in again. Which AWS identity should the solutions architect recommend for this use case? 1 point A. AWS account root user B. AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) user C. IAM Role D. IAM Group

According to the AWS shared responsibility model, which of the following is the responsibility of AWS? 1 point A. Controlling the operating system and application platform, as well as encrypting, protecting, and managing customer data. B. quizSrc.term: Which of the following is recommended if a company has a single AWS account, and multiple people who work with AWS services in that account? 1 point A. All people must use the root user to work with AWS services on a daily basis. B. The company should create an AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) group, grant the group permissions to perform specific job functions, and assign users to a group, or use IAM roles. C. The company must create AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) users, and grant users the permissions to perform specific job functions. D. The company must create an AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) user and grant the user the permissions to access all AWS resources.
quizSrc.definition: B. The company should create an AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) group, grant the group permissions to perform specific job functions, and assign users to a group, or use IAM roles.

quizSrc.term: True or False: According to the AWS shared responsibility model, a customer is responsible for security in the cloud. 1 point A. True B. False

Which of the following provides temporary credentials (that expire after a defined period of time) to AWS services? 1 point A. Principle of least privilege B. IAM role C. Identity provider (IdP) D. AWS IAM Identity Center (successor to AWS Single Sign-On)

Which information is needed to create a virtual private cloud (VPC)? 1 point A. The Availability Zone that the VPC will reside in. B. The subnet that the VPC will reside in. C. The AWS Region that the VPC will reside in. D. The group of subnets that the VPC will reside in.
quizSrc.definition: C. The AWS Region that the VPC will reside in.

quizSrc.term: Which of the following can a route table be attached to? 1 point A. AWS Accounts B. Availability Zone C. Subnets D. Regions

A company wants to allow resources in a public subnet to communicate with the internet. Which of the following must the company do to meet this requirement? 1 point A. Create a route to a private subnet B. Attach an internet gateway to their VPC C. Create a route in a route table to the internet gateway D. A and B E. B and C

What is the compute as a service (CaaS) model? 1 point A. The CaaS model requires that users purchase virtual machines and manually provision servers to run a workload. B. The CaaS model offers computing resources (such as virtual machines that run on servers in data centers) on demand, by using virtual services. C. The CaaS model offers large discounts for computing resources. However, users must run the workload from the server that is stored on-premises. D. The CaaS model delivers cloud-based applications to users across the globe, over the internet.
quizSrc.definition: B. The CaaS model offers computing resources (such as virtual machines that run on servers in data centers) on demand, by using virtual services.

quizSrc.term: Which statement about the default settings of a security group is TRUE? 1 point A. Allows all inbound traffic and blocks all outbound traffic by default. B. Blocks all inbound traffic and allows all outbound traffic by default. C. Allows all inbound and outbound traffic by default. D. Blocks all inbound and outbound traffic by default.
quizSrc.definition: B. Blocks all inbound traffic and allows all outbound traffic by default.

quizSrc.term: What does an Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instance type indicate? 1 point A. Instance family and instance size B. Instance placement and instance size C. Instance tenancy and instance billing D. Instance Amazon Machine Image (AMI) and networking speed
quizSrc.definition: A. Instance family and instance size

quizSrc.term: What is the difference between using AWS Fargate or Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) as the compute platform for Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS)? 1 point A. With AWS Fargate, AWS manages and provisions the underlying infrastructure for hosting containers. B. With Amazon ECS on Amazon EC2, AWS manages and provisions the underlying EC2 instance for containers. C. With AWS Fargate, users need to manage cluster capacity and scaling. D. With Amazon ECS on Amazon EC2, users need to upload only the source code. Amazon ECS takes care of the rest.
quizSrc.definition: A. With AWS Fargate, AWS manages and provisions the underlying infrastructure for hosting containers.

quizSrc.term: Which statement about serverless is TRUE? 1 point A. Users must provision and manage servers. B. Users must manually scale serverless resources. C. Users do not pay for idle resources. D. Users must manage availability and fault tolerance.
quizSrc.definition: C. Users do not pay for idle resources.

quizSrc.term: True or False: AWS Lambda is always the best solution when running applications on AWS. 1 point A. True B. False
Which compute service does Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) provide? 1 point A. Container services B. Serverless C. Virtual machines (VMs) D. Analytics

Which stage of the instance lifecycle is an instance in when the account starts to accumulate charges? 1 point A. When an instance is in a pending stage B. When an instance is in a running stage C. When an instance is stopped D. When an instance is terminated
quizSrc.definition: B. When an instance is in a running stage

quizSrc.term: Which component of the c5.4xlarge instance determines the instance family and generation number? 1 point A. 4x B. Large C. 4xlarge D. c5

Which container runtime can be used to host a container on an Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instance? 1 point A. Docker B. Container C. Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) D. Amazon EC2

quizSrc.definition: B. An upload of a file to the Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) source bucket

quizSrc.term: True or False: With serverless, users do not need to provision and manage servers. 1 point A. True B. False

What is the difference between network access control lists (ACLs) and security groups? 1 point A. By default, network ACLs allow incoming traffic and block outgoing traffic from a subnet. Users can change these settings to provide an additional layer of security. However, the default configurations of security groups block all traffic. B. By default, network ACLs block all traffic from a subnet. However, the default configurations of security groups allow all inbound and outbound traffic. Users can change these settings to provide an additional layer of security. C. By default, network ACLs block incoming traffic and allow outgoing traffic. The default configurations of security groups block all traffic. Users can change these settings when they configure networking for their instance. D. quizSrc.definition: D. By default, network ACLs allow incoming and outgoing traffic from a subnet. Users can change these settings to provide an additional layer of security. However, the default configurations of security groups block all inbound traffic and allow all outbound traffic.

quizSrc.term: What is a typical use case for Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3)? 1 point A. Object storage for media hosting B. Object storage for a boot drive C. Block storage for an Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instance D. File storage for multiple Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instances
quizSrc.definition: A. Object storage for media hosting

quizSrc.term: A company needs a storage layer for a high-transaction relational database on an Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instance. Which service should the company use? 1 point A. Amazon EC2 Instance Store B. Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) C. Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) D. Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS)
quizSrc.definition: B. Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS)

quizSrc.term: True or False: Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volumes are considered ephemeral storage. 1 point A. True B. False

quizSrc.term: Which database is a non-relational database that stores data in key-value pairs, and is a good fit for hosting simple lookup tables? 1 point A. Amazon DynamoDB B. Amazon DocumentDB C. Amazon Neptune D. Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS)

quizSrc.term: An analytics company uses AWS Glue to extract, transform, and load data. What is the role of the AWS Glue Metadata Catalog in this process? 1 point A. The AWS Glue Metadata Catalog provides a repository where the company can store, find, and access metadata, and then use that metadata to query and transform the data. B. The AWS Glue Metadata Catalog provides a repository where the company can store and find metadata to keep track of user permissions for data in a data lake. C. The AWS Glue Metadata Catalog provides a data transformation service that the company can use to author and run scripts for transforming data between data sources and targets. D. The AWS Glue Metadata Catalog is a query service that uses standard Structured Query Language (SQL) to retrieve data.
quizSrc.definition: A. The AWS Glue Metadata Catalog provides a repository where the company can store, find, and access metadata, and then use that metadata to query and transform the data.

quizSrc.term: True or False: AWS Lake Formation is a centralized repository, such as a data lake, that stores structured and unstructured data at any scale. 1 point A. True B. False

A solutions architect is working for a company that plans to use AWS Glue to prepare data for analytics. Why should the solutions architect recommend that the company set up crawlers? 1 point A. Crawlers build and scale a data lake of any size in a secure environment. B. Crawlers scan data in repositories, classify the data, extract schema information from it, and store the metadata automatically in the AWS Glue Data Catalog. C. Crawlers optimize storage costs by automatically moving data to the most cost-effective storage access tier, with little performance impact or operational overhead. D. Crawlers store, annotate, and share metadata in the AWS Cloud in a similar way to the Apache Hive Metastore.
quizSrc.definition: B. Crawlers scan data in repositories, classify the data, extract schema information from it, and store the metadata automatically in the AWS Glue Data Catalog.

quizSrc.term: What is the structure of the AWS Glue Metadata Catalog? 1 point A. The AWS Glue Metadata Catalog is the storage that is associated with automated database backups and any active database snapshots. It consists of the General Purpose SSD, Provisioned IOPS SSD, Throughput Optimized HDD, and Cold HDD volume types. B. The AWS Glue Metadata Catalog consists of file systems or databases for any applications that require fine, granular updates and access to raw, unformatted, block-level storage. C. The AWS Glue Metadata Catalog consists of tables. Each table has a schema, which outlines the structure of a table, including columns, data type definitions, and more. The tables are organized into logical groups that are called databases. D. The AWS Glue Metadata Catalog contains buckets with different types of storage options. AWS Glue Metadata Catalog stores data as objects in these buckets.
quizSrc.definition: C. The AWS Glue Metadata Catalog consists of tables. Each table has a schema, which outlines the structure of a table, including columns, data type definitions, and more. The tables are organized into logical groups that are called databases.

quizSrc.term: True or False: Customers can use Amazon API Gateway to ingest real-time data in a RESTful manner through the creation of an HTTP-based API, which acts as the front door or interface to ingestion logic or data lake storage on the backend. 1 point A. True B. False

Which statement about AWS Lake Formation is true? 1 point A. AWS Lake Formation deploys, operates, and scales clusters in the AWS Cloud B. AWS Lake Formation registers the Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) buckets and paths where the data lake will reside. C. AWS Lake Formation runs big data frameworks, such as Apache Hadoop. D. AWS Lake Formation ingests, cleanses, and transforms the structured and organized data.
quizSrc.definition: B. AWS Lake Formation registers the Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) buckets and paths where the data lake will reside.

quizSrc.term: Which service is commonly used for real-time data processing when Amazon Kinesis Data Streams is used for data ingestion? 1 point A. Amazon EMR B. AWS Glue Jobs C. Amazon Kinesis Data Analytics D. Amazon Athena

Apache Hadoop is an open-source framework that is used to efficiently store and process large datasets. A solutions architect is working for a company that currently uses Apache Hadoop on-premises for data processing jobs. The company wants to use AWS for these jobs, but they also want to continue using the same technology. Which service should the solutions architect choose for this use case? 1 point A. Amazon EMR B. AWS Lambda C. Amazon Kinesis Data Analytics D. Amazon OpenSearch Service

A team of machine learning (ML) experts are working for a company. The company wants to use the data in their data lake to train an ML model that they create. The company wants the most control that they can have over this model and the environment that it is trained in. Which AWS ML approach should the team take? 1 point A. Launch an Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instance by using an AWS Deep Learning Amazon Machine Image (AMI) to host the application that will train the model. B. Create an AWS Lambda function with the training logic in the handler, and run the training based on an event. C. Launch an Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instance and run Amazon SageMaker on it to train the model. D. Use a pretrained model from an AWS service, such as Amazon Rekognition.
quizSrc.definition: A. Launch an Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instance by using an AWS Deep Learning Amazon Machine Image (AMI) to host the application that will train the model.

quizSrc.term: Which services can query data that is needed to build reports? (Choose TWO.) 1 point A. Amazon Athena B. AWS Lambda C. Amazon Glue D. Amazon Redshift E. Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud
True or False: Amazon Kinesis processes and analyzes data as it arrives, and there is no need to wait until all data is collected before the processing can begin. 1 point A. True B. False

A company wants to transfer files into and out of Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) storage by using AWS Transfer Family. Several users in the company need permissions to access a specific object storage bucket that hosts the files from AWS Transfer Family. What is the BEST way to provide the needed bucket-access permissions to these users? 1 point A. AWS account root user B. AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) user C. AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role D. Access keys
quizSrc.definition: C. AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role

quizSrc.term: What is the most common way of categorizing data in terms of structure? 1 point A. Structured data, unstructured data, and semi-structured data B. Ready data, not-ready data, and semi-ready data C. The good data, the bad data, and the ugly data D. Development data, quality assurance (QA) data, and production data
quizSrc.definition: A. Structured data, unstructured data, and semi-structured data

quizSrc.term: A solutions architect is tasked with transporting data from their organization to AWS by using the AWS Snow Family. The organization wants to transport data that needs less than 8 terabytes (TB) of usable storage. Which Snow Family device should the solutions architect recommend for this use case? 1 point A. AWS Snowball B. AWS Glue C. AWS Snowcone D. AWS Snowmobile

Which statement about the AWS Glue crawler is TRUE? 1 point A. An AWS Glue crawler collects and catalogs data from databases and object storage, moves the data into a new Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) data lake, and classifies the data by using machine learning algorithms. B. An AWS Glue crawler can scan a data store, such as an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket, and use the data from the data store to create or update tables in the AWS Glue Data Catalog. C. An AWS Glue crawler runs Structured Query Language (SQL) queries to analyze data directly in Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3). D. An AWS Glue crawler performs interactive log analytics, real-time application monitoring, website search, and more.
quizSrc.definition: B. An AWS Glue crawler can scan a data store, such as an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket, and use the data from the data store to create or update tables in the AWS Glue Data Catalog.
